tool.name: Paffy invert
tool.description: inverts the query and target in a PAF file
tool.command: #if $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') gunzip -c '$input_paf' | #end if paffy invert --logLevel 'INFO' --outputFile '$out_file' #if not $input_paf.ext.endswith('.gz') --inputFile '$input_paf' #end if
tool.help: Paffy invert swaps the query and target columns in a PAF file. This is useful when you want to reinterpret the alignment from the perspective of the original target as the query, without remapping sequences. As output, a new PAF file is generated with the inverted alignments.
